title.narrative: Malawi: Shire River Basin Management Program (Phase-I) Project

description.narrative: The overall Program Development Objective of the Shire River Basin Management Program is to generate sustainable social, economic and environmental benefits by effectively and collaboratively planning, developing and managing the Shire River Basin's natural resources. The program would support the Government's Shire basin Policy Letter , and would have a duration of 12-15 years. The first phase project – the Shire River Basin Management Program (Phase-I) Project (SRBMP) – would establish coordinated inter-sectoral development planning and coordination mechanisms, undertake the most urgent water related infrastructure investments, prepare additional infrastructure investments, and develop up-scalable systems and methods to rehabilitate sub-catchments and protect existing natural forests, wetlands and biodiversity. Future phases would consolidate Basin planning and development mechanisms and institutions, undertake further infrastructure investments, and up-scale catchment rehabilitation for sustainable natural resource management and livelihoods. The Project Development Objective (PDO) of the SRBMP is to develop a Shire River Basin planning framework and improve land and water management for ecosystem and livelihood benefits in target areas. The project would:(a) strengthen the institutionalcapacities and mechanisms for Shire Basin monitoring, planning, management and decision support systems; (b) invest in water related infrastructure that sustainably improves water resources management and development; (c) reduce erosion in priority catchments andsedimentation and flooding downstream, while enhancing environmental services, agricultural productivity and improving livelihoods;(d) improve flood management in the Lower Shire and provide community level adaptatin and mitigation support; and (e) protect and enhance ecological services in the Basin.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Water Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article V | Description :Effectiveness condition: GEF Grant Agreement and the LDCF Grant Agreement have beenexecuted and delivered and all conditions precedent to their effectiveness or to the right of the Recipient to make withdrawalsthereunder (other than the effectiveness of this Agreement) have been fulfilled | Due Date :31-Jul-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 IA; LDCF Grant Agreement: Article II 2.03 | Description :Provision requiring maintenance of relevantinstitutional arrangements (Program Steering Committee, Program Technical Committee, Multi-Sector Technical Team) and staffing toenable implementation. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 IB; LDCF Grant Agreement: Article II 2.03 | Description :Provision requiring implementation ofproject in accordance with the Project Implementation Plan and preparation of regular Annual Work Plans. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 ID: LDCF Grant Agreement: Article II 2.03 | Description :Provisions requiring community subgrants tobe carried out according to criteria and procedures acceptable to the Association | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 IE7 (iii) | Description :The recipient shall furnish to the Association for review, not later thanSeptember 1, 2018 or the date on which at least 95% of the Financing has been disbursed, whichever occurs earlier, operationalprocedures with respect to the dams constructed or upgraded under the Project | Due Date :01-Sep-2018

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 IE7 (iv) | Description :A Dam operational and maintenance plan no later than six (6) months prior tothe commissioning of the upgraded Kamuzu Barrage | Due Date :30-April-2018

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 IE: LDCF Grant Agreement: Article II 2.03 | Description :Provisions requiring the Project to becarried out in accordance with the provisions of the Safeguard Instruments and Bank Safeguard Policies. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 II; LDCF Grant Agreement: Article II 2.04, 2.05 | Description :Provisions requiring the Receipt tomonitor and evaluate project process and prepare regular project reports, maintain a financial management system and providequarterly interim unaudited financial reports and audited annual Financial Statements. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 II; LDCF Grant Agreement: Article II 2.06 | Description :Provisions requiring the recipient toundertake procurement according to the agreed methods and procedures | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 IV; LDCF Grant Agreement: Article III | Description :Provisions requiring the recipient to withdrawproceeds of the Financing in accordance with the agreed categories of Eligible Expenditures and applicable guidelines | Frequency:Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 3 | Description :Provision requiring the Recipient to undertake repayment of the Credit according tothe agreed schedule | Frequency :Yearly
